{{primary sources|date=December 2009}}
{{no footnotes|date=July 2009}} {{lowercase}} {{Infobox software | name = eMeSeNe | logo = [[File:Emesene-logo.png]] | screenshot = [[File:Emesene.png|150px]] | caption = emesene under the [[GNOME]] [[desktop environment]] | developer = emesene team | released = 2006 | latest_release_version = 2.11.11 | latest_release_date = {{Start date and age|2011|11|12}} | latest_preview_version = [[Git (software)|Git]]: [http://github.com/emesene/emesene 2.11.10-devel] | latest_preview_date = | programming_language = [[Python (programming language)|Python]] | operating_system = [[Cross-platform]] | genre = [[Instant Messaging]] | license = [[GNU General Public License|GNU GPL]] | website = [http://blog.emesene.org/ emesene's website] }}
'''emesene''' is an [[Open-source software|open source]] [[instant messaging]] client designed for use with Microsoft's [[.NET Messenger Service]]. It is a [[Clone (computing)|clone]] of [[Windows Live Messenger]]. emesene is the [[Spanish language|Spanish]] (also [[Portuguese language|Portuguese]] and [[French language|French]]) pronunciation of MSN, former name of Windows Live Messenger. It is also supports external messaging services like [[Jabber]], [[Facebook]] and [[Google Talk]].
Its goal is to replicate the functions of the official Windows Live client in a simpler, cleaner and easier to use [[GUI|interface]].
emesene is licensed under the [[GNU General Public License]], and is developed by Luis Mariano Guerra along with other contributors.
== Development == emesene is [[cross-platform]], with binaries available for [[Microsoft Windows]], [[Linux]] and [[Mac OS X]]. The program is written using [[Python (programming language)|Python]], [[GTK+]], [[PyGTK]] and [http://www.cairographics.org/pycairo/ Pycairo].
== Compatibility == The current version of emesene is compatible with the Windows Live Messenger protocol [[Microsoft Notification Protocol#MSNP18|MSNP18]], [[Jabber]], [[Facebook]] and [[Google Talk]]
=== Official Windows Live Messenger features supported by the client are === * Offline messaging * Personal messages * Nudges * Contact list retrieval from server * Nickname and Avatar retrieval from server * Tabbed chat windows * Blocking/Unblocking Contacts * File transfer * Webcam support (2.11.11dev, not available in current stable builds) * "Now Playing" personal messages (via plugin)
=== Other features specific to emesene are === * Plugin Support * Minimize to notification area ([[Taskbar#Taskbar elements|System Tray]]) * Window and icon themes * [[Emoticon]] themes * Multilingual support * [[Ubuntu (operating system)|Ubuntu]] Messaging Menu and Me Menu Support * Support for external messaging systems [[Jabber]], [[Facebook]] and [[Google Talk]] * Growl support (OS X only)
== Emesene2 == Emesene2 has been released, but is still under active development, polishing and enhancement. Some modifications targeted at development: * New Plugin system * Session management ([[.NET Framework|.NET]], [[Extensible Messaging and Presence Protocol|XMPP/Jabber]], [[eserver]]) * GUI separated from the protocol library * All the protocol stuff runs on different threads * The code is structured, documented and validated using [[pylint]] and following the [http://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-0008/ PEP-8] guidelines * Panel & Window Theming
== See also == {{Portal|Free software}} * [[Comparison of instant messaging clients]]
== References == {{reflist}} * https://www.ohloh.net/p/emesene * http://www.osalt.com/emesene * http://blog.emesene.org/2011/05/some-news.html * http://blog.emesene.org/2011/04/emesene-2114-released.html * http://blog.emesene.org/2011/07/emesene-2117.html
